name: Abadar
edict: bring civilization to the frontiers, earn wealth through hard work and trade, follow the rule of law
anathema: engage in banditry or piracy, steal, undermine a law-abiding court
domains: Cities, Creation, Duty, Earth, Metal, Toil, Travel, Wealth
pantheons: Talons of the Godclaw, The Deliberate Journey, The Godclaw, The Offering Plate, The Resplendent Court, Urban Prosperity

name: Arazni
edict: act with dignity, do whatever it takes to survive, despise and never forgive those who have hurt you
anathema: create unwilling undead, insult Arazni

name: Asmodeus
edict: negotiate contracts to your best advantage, rule tyrannically and torture weaker beings, show subservience to your betters
anathema: break a contract, share power with the weak, insult Asmodeus by showing mercy to your enemies
domains: Confidence, Duty, Fire, Glyph, Toil, Trickery, Tyranny
pantheons: Talons of the Godclaw, The Godclaw

name: Calistria
edict: pursue your personal freedom, seek hedonistic thrills, take revenge
anathema: become too consumed by love or a need for revenge, let a slight go unanswered
pantheons: Elven Pantheon, Sovyrian Conclave, The Last Breath, The Tides of Chaos

name: Cayden Cailean
edict: drink, aid the oppressed, seek glory and adventure
anathema: waste alcohol, be mean or standoffish when drunk, oppress the vulnerable
pantheons: Good Neighbors, Guardians of the Sacred Self, The Divine Dare, The Freeing Flame, The Laborer's Bastion, The Offering Plate

name: Desna
edict: aid fellow travelers, explore new places, express yourself through art and song, find what life has to offer
anathema: foster despair or terror in the innocent, cast nightmare or use similar magic to corrupt dreams, engage in bigoted behavior
domains: Dreams, Luck, Moon, Nothingness, Repose, Star, Travel
pantheons: Cosmic Caravan, Cosmic Caravan, Elven Pantheon, Fortune's Fate, Radiant Prism, Sovyrian Conclave, The Deliberate Journey, The Path of the Heavens, The Prismatic Ray

name: Erastil
edict: care for your home and family, fulfill your duties, keep the peace, protect the community
anathema: abandon your home in its time of need, choose yourself over your community, tarnish your reputation, tell lies

name: Gozreh
edict: cherish, protect, and respect nature in all its forms
anathema: bring civilization to intrude on the wild, create undead, despoil areas of natural beauty
pantheons: Guardians of the Sacred Self, Seafarer's Hope, Weight of the World

name: Iomedae
edict: be temperate, fight for justice and honor, hold valor in your heart
anathema: abandon a companion in need, dishonor yourself, refuse a challenge from an equal
pantheons: Talons of the Godclaw, The Godclaw

name: Irori
edict: be humble; help others perfect themselves; hone your body, mind, and spirit to a more perfect state; practice discipline
anathema: engage in overly unhealthy or self-destructive behaviors, destroy an important historical text, repeatedly fail to maintain self-control
domains: Change, Introspection, Knowledge, Might, Perfection, Truth, Vigil
pantheons: Pillars of Knowledge, Talons of the Godclaw, The Godclaw

name: Lamashtu
edict: bring power to outcasts and the downtrodden, indoctrinate others in Lamashtu’s teachings, make the beautiful monstrous, reveal the corruption and flaws in all things
anathema: attempt to change that which makes you different, provide succor to Lamashtu’s enemies
domains: Abomination, Change, Family, Might, Nightmares, Trickery

name: Divine Mysteries pg. 78
edict: seek out magical power and use it
anathema: continually pursue mundane paths over magical ones
domains: Destruction, Disorientation, Glyph, Knowledge, Magic, Protection

name: Norgorber
edict: keep your true identity secret, sacrifice anyone necessary, take every advantage in a fight, work from the shadows
anathema: allow your true identity to be connected to your foul dealings, share a secret freely, show mercy
pantheons: Shadow Cabinet, The Tides of Chaos

name: Pharasma
edict: strive to understand ancient prophecies, destroy undead, lay bodies to rest
anathema: create undead, desecrate a corpse, take from the dead in bad faith
domains: Death, Fate, Healing, Knowledge, Soul, Time, Vigil

name: Rovagug
edict: destroy all things, free Rovagug from his prison
anathema: create something new, let material ties restrain you, torture a victim or otherwise delay its destruction
domains: Air, Destruction, Earth, Nothingness, Swarm, Zeal

name: Divine Mysteries pg. 94
edict: destroy the Spawn of Rovagug, protect allies, provide aid to the sick and wounded, seek and allow redemption
anathema: create undead, lie, deny a repentant creature an opportunity for redemption, fail to strike down evil
pantheons: Cosmic Caravan, Cosmic Caravan, Radiant Prism, The Path of the Heavens, The Prismatic Ray, Touch of the Sun

name: Shelyn
edict: be peaceful, choose and perfect an art, lead by example, see the beauty in all things
anathema: destroy art or allow it to be destroyed, unless saving a life or pursuing greater art; refuse to accept surrender
pantheons: Guardians of the Sacred Self, Radiant Prism, The Enlightened Scholar's Path, The Prismatic Ray, The Resplendent Court

name: Torag
edict: be honorable and forthright, keep your word, respect the forge, serve your people
anathema: tell lies or cheat someone, intentionally create inferior works, show continued mercy to the enemies of your people when such enemies prove they are undeserving
domains: Creation, Duty, Earth, Family, Metal, Protection
pantheons: Demon Bringers, Dwarven Pantheon, Good Neighbors, Stone's Blood, The Godclaw, The Laborer's Bastion, Wheels of Innovation

name: Urgathoa
edict: become undead upon death, create or protect the undead, sate your appetites
anathema: deny your appetites, destroy undead of no harm to you, sacrifice your life
domains: Decay, Indulgence, Magic, Might, Plague, Swarm, Undeath

name: Zon-Kuthon
edict: bring pain to the world, mutilate your body
anathema: create permanent or long-lasting sources of light, provide comfort to those who suffer

name: Baalzebul
edict: Defend civilization from chaos, live an honest and just life, be impartial in judgment and reveal the truth
anathema: Deal unfairly with your family or community, destroy the environment, lie

name: Barbatos
edict: Convey yourself with regal dignity, claim what you desire and deserve, seek vengeance on those who wrong you
anathema: Provoke Baalzebul’s envy, show humility
domains: Air, Ambition, Magic, Secrecy, Swarm, Toil, Trickery

name: Belial
edict: Veil your motives, make dangerous deals, offer incomplete and ruinous knowledge
anathema: Hide any plot against your masters, close or interfere with portals to Hell

name: Dispater
edict: Indulge your basest desires, create deadly weapons
anathema: Impede an act of high hedonism, become too attached to a lover or project

name: Geryon
edict: Uphold absolute law, pursue perfection in your surroundings, speak with refinement
anathema: Act above your station, neglect your defenses, betray a lover

name: Mammon
edict: Hoard knowledge, test the boundaries of taboo, spread falsehoods to dupe the foolhardy
anathema: Declare knowledge heresy or forbidden, break your word
domains: Dragon, Knowledge, Might, Secrecy, Truth, Water

name: Mephistopheles
edict: Gain financial control over others, gather new wealth, count your riches
anathema: Leave the cult of Mammon, allow those who steal from you to go unpunished
domains: Ambition, Creation, Earth, Metal, Toil, Wealth

name: Moloch
edict: Master laws and use them to your benefit, enable the desperate, excoriate others with veiled mockery
anathema: Break a contract you made, get caught breaking the law

name: Blooms of the Spreading Weald
edict: Spread Hell’s order through war, convert communities to sole worship of Moloch, sacrifice creatures in fire
anathema: Defy a military superior, flee in battle (unless ordered to do so), lose your combat edge due to your vices
domains: Destruction, Duty, Fire, Metal, Might, Toil

name: Breath of the Endless Sky
edict: encourage natural growth even in urban areas, expertly craft wooden furniture and other items, fight against blight
anathema: exploit natural resources such as timber, use herbs and fungi to make deadly poisons

name: Faith in the Fallen
edict: respect creatures capable of natural flight, revel in the glory of flight, stop to feel breezes across your body when possible
anathema: pollute the air with excessive smoke or chemicals, suffocate a living creature
domains: Air, Cold, Dust, Freedom, Lightning, Travel

name: Good Neighbors
edict: embody the best aspects of those who risked their souls to seek divinity, respect and remember the sacrifice of others, seek out and aid those on the verge of divinity
anathema: allow the deceased to be forgotten, dismiss another’s beliefs no matter how strange they might seem, fail to aid others once you have promised to do so
domains: Change, Cities, Fate, Pain, Sorrow, Vigil

name: Light of the Everlasting Flame
edict: participate in the betterment of your community, provide aid after disasters damage settlements, volunteer your time and resources for good causes
anathema: allow a community space to fall into disrepair, dictate where and how people should live

name: Shadow Cabinet
edict: carry a light source at all times, express your wrath through smoke and flame, warm those who are cold
anathema: cover or extinguish a flame without reason, languish in the darkness for no reason

name: Shapes of the Fading Luster
edict: glean sensitive information through underhanded means, infiltrate powerful organizations, keep your own secrets
anathema: allow your agenda to be discovered through carelessness, destroy information when it doesn’t personally benefit you

name: The Pandemonia
edict: craft with metal, either allow a piece of metal to rust away or continually keep it polished, learn the highest secrets of alchemy
anathema: destroy metallic objects quickly instead of letting them rust away, purposefully transform a precious metal into a base metal
domains: Change, Cities, Decay, Knowledge, Lightning, Metal

name: The Readied Strike
edict: disrupt the status quo, never given reasons for your actions, play elaborate tricks on the unsuspecting
anathema: fall into a set routine, fix something that you have broken
domains: Change, Disorientation, Dreams, Luck, Nightmares, Trickery

name: The Tides of Chaos
edict: encourage unity against common foes, maintain clear lines of communication during warfare, share training and tactics with allies
anathema: abandon or lie to allies, initiate violence against unidentified persons, refuse to train those seeking to learn

name: Treasures of the Eternal Delve
edict: keep all secrets entrusted to you, sow mistrust, doubt, and conspiracy at every opportunity, take risks
anathema: aid in the establishment of a government or ruling power, embrace complacency, reveal secrets entrusted to you
domains: Cities, Darkness, Decay, Destruction, Nightmares, Secrecy

name: Waves of the Boundless Sea
edict: appreciate the beauty of all stones, safely mine for ore, walk barefoot across soil or stones when possible
anathema: purposefully cause a cave-in, shatter a precious gem

name: Anogetz
edict: allow the currents of life take you where they may, travel the expansive seas, wash away dust and dirt with seawater
anathema: allow a creature to drown when you could save them, toss detritus into the oceans

name: Cixyron
edict: Be as merciless (or more so) as your oppressors, indulge as beasts indulge, let your rage fuel your deeds
anathema: Refrain from harming an oppressor’s loved ones, spare a tyrant’s life
domains: Ambition, Destruction, Freedom, Indulgence, Swarm, Zeal

name: Corosbel
edict: Engineer complex acts of vengeance, construct glorious instruments of war, instill terror in your enemies from a distance
anathema: Intentionally destroy a weapon that you have crafted, explain your reasoning to someone less knowledgeable than you
domains: Destruction, Fire, Knowledge, Lightning, Metal, Toil

name: Laivatiniel
edict: Convert other faithful into lives of excess, take what is due to you as a divine messenger, tempt others into false worship
anathema: Deny yourself an opportunity to extort your flock, perform an act of true selflessness
domains: Death, Nothingness, Secrecy, Soul, Trickery, Tyranny

name: Pavnuri
edict: Allow anxiety and jealousy to rule your actions, impose your will upon those who see you as a parental figure, usurp praise given to others for actions you may have suggested
anathema: Cede authority to another guardian, heed advice from your child or charge, ignore an opportunity to remind your charge of their place
domains: Disorientation, Family, Protection, Sorrow, Trickery, Tyranny

name: Tresmalvos
edict: Consume the flesh of your own kind, hoard secrets, never speak plainly when you can speak in metaphor or code
anathema: Feed another out of kindness or pity, give up an intimate secret without gain
domains: Glyph, Knowledge, Nothingness, Secrecy, Trickery, Undeath

name: Vorasha
edict: Chase material wealth, oppress the less fortunate, think only of the current moment
anathema: Give a gift without expectation of reciprocation, participate in maintaining urban infrastructure
domains: Darkness, Indulgence, Plague, Swarm, Water, Wealth

name: Xsistaid
edict: Lay your enemies low through deceit and subtlety, preserve your patience for longterm goals, venerate all scaled creatures
anathema: Cultivate or maintain a garden of nonpoisonous plants, intentionally harm a venomous serpent not in self-defense
domains: Decay, Dragon, Magic, Naga, Pain, Water

name: Zelishkar
edict: Feed on others without guilt, rob others of strength to embolden yourself, wield your weakness as your weapon
anathema: Fail to take advantage of someone’s kindness, take only what you need when you could get away with more
domains: Death, Decay, Pain, Plague, Swarm, Undeath

name: Alazhra
edict: Burn the remains of your defeated enemies and closest allies, destroy the accomplishments of your so-called betters, wield flame as a tool and a weapon
anathema: Accept the motivations of others at face value, extinguish a raging fire
domains: Ambition, Destruction, Duty, Fire, Star, Zeal

name: Anubis
edict: Break down barriers between planes, instill nightmares in others, work with hags and their covens
anathema: Betray a hag without good cause, draw the ire of an Apocalypse Rider, relieve the nightmares of others
domains: Darkness, Disorientation, Dreams, Nightmares, Nothingness, Soul, Travel

name: Aroden
edict: Lay bodies to rest, destroy undead, be impartial in judgment
anathema: Desecrate a corpse, take from the dead in bad faith, trap a soul

name: Cernunnos
edict: Create inventions and make innovations, record history, support your fellow humans, work toward your goals and destiny
anathema: Destroy historical texts or records; sabotage another’s attempts to achieve their destiny; undermine civilization through assassination, theft, and other societal ills
domains: Ambition, Confidence, Creation, Fate, Knowledge, Toil, Travel

name: Cormigus
edict: Protect forests and other natural areas, advocate for animals and plants, take and commit to decisive actions
anathema: Fail to strike down evil, enable the destruction of wilderness, needlessly kill animals

name: Gorum
edict: Encourage communication with others, share important news, visit sites of extreme loudness or silence
anathema: Cast silence and similar spells, intentionally share information you know to be incorrect, remove others’ ability to speak
domains: Creation, Duty, Glyph, Knowledge, Secrecy, Travel

name: Grundinnar
edict: attain victory in fair combat, push your limits, wear armor in combat
anathema: kill prisoners or surrendering foes, prevent conflict through negotiation, win a battle through underhanded tactics or indirect magic

name: Divine Mysteries pg. 312
edict: Attempt to bridge the gap between feuding sides, maintain just treaties, maintain relations with neighbors
anathema: Sow discord among friends and allies, attack during parley

name: Gyronna
edict: Expose hypocrisy (real or imagined) in others, make other creatures miserable, demand bribes to spare creatures from your torments
anathema: Allow others to slight you without retaliation, seek the approval of society, forgive those who have wronged you

name: Isis
edict: Protect those you have authority over, maintain harmony in your community
anathema: Undermine a rightful ruler, knowingly serve a usurper

name: Ma’at
edict: Provide aid to the sick and wounded, use magic to help others, mourn the cherished dead, ritually purify yourself before entering sacred areas
anathema: Educate the uninitiated in sacred rites, betray loved ones or family, discriminate based on social class

name: Mestama
edict: Defend civilization from chaos, live an honest and just life, be impartial in judgment and reveal the truth
anathema: Deal unfairly with your family or community, destroy the environment, lie

name: Osiris
edict: Enact disproportionate vengeance, manipulate others to enact your plans, tear down your rivals through both subtlety and violence
anathema: Declare your schemes openly, harm an allied witch or hag
domains: Magic, Nightmares, Pain, Passion, Secrecy, Trickery

name: Ra
edict: Ensure the health of crops and vegetation, protect the bodies and souls of the worthy dead, avenge the wrongly murdered
anathema: Dismember a creature, desecrate a corpse, show ingratitude for a sincere gift

name: Smiad
edict: Bring order to places of chaos, kill evil monsters and fiends, encourage just laws, provide warmth where needed
anathema: Avoid personal change, kill a plant or a creature with cold damage, seal a building to completely block sunlight

name: Sturovenen
edict: Slay evil dragons, aid benevolent dragons, train others in dragonslaying techniques
anathema: Accept the words of an evil dragon as truth, allow benevolent dragons to be harmed by your actions or inaction, fail to teach others the differences between dragons

name: Thoth
edict: Act with conviction and confidence, be a passionate and responsible leader to your people or companions
anathema: Command a subordinate to perform a task you’re not willing to perform yourself
domains: Air, Confidence, Dragon, Passion, Sun, Zeal

name: Ydersius
edict: Maintain order in society and the multiverse, innovate scientific and magical knowledge, record events
anathema: Upset stable mechanisms or ecosystems, fail to correct false information

name: Abraxas
edict: seek to return Ydersius to life, fulfill your passions, conquer your foes with no mercy, achieve glory for serpentkind
anathema: put the needs of others above those of serpentfolk, aid the spawn of Azlant

name: Angazhan
edict: Learn and hoard forbidden magic, steal secrets from others
anathema: Destroy forbidden lore, reveal the entirety of a secret

name: Areshkagal
edict: Commit acts of brutal violence, test yourself against nature, make animals more dangerous
anathema: Cower from fights, allow yourself to be resurrected instead of reincarnated
domains: Destruction, Indulgence, Might, Nature, Tyranny, Zeal

name: Baphomet
edict: Clear paths and portals, develop new riddles, hide your intentions
anathema: Reveal knowledge without personal gain, show mercy to cultists of Aldinach, willingly relinquish wealth
domains: Air, Glyph, Knowledge, Travel, Trickery, Wealth

name: Cyth-V’sug
edict: Confuse paths and roads, outwit your foes instead of overpowering them, unleash beasts to kill others
anathema: Kill something that cannot significantly harm you, bargain with Asmodeus

name: Dagon
edict: Corrupt all that exists with parasites or fungus, promote the growth of fungus, feast on rotten flesh or fungus
anathema: Purify your food, cure a disease or kill a parasite, tolerate another demon lord or their servants (except Treerazer )

name: Gogunta
edict: Swim underwater, improve your own strength, encourage the spread of dangerous sea monsters
anathema: Break a sworn oath, settle in a landlocked area, share Dagon’s secrets with outsiders

name: Haagenti
edict: sacrifice creatures by drowning them, frolic or sing in swamps, feed or aid amphibians
anathema: grant mercy to boggards who worship other gods

name: Jezelda
edict: Practice alchemical transmutations, pursue knowledge whatever the cost, use your inventions to exploit others
anathema: Aid Yamasoth , allow morality to interfere with research, destroy knowledge
domains: Ambition, Change, Creation, Might, Toil, Wealth

name: Kabriri
edict: Eat raw meat and blood, hunt on the night of the full moon, prey on the weak and defenseless
anathema: Betray your pack, offer succor to nonwerewolf shapeshifters, use silver as a weapon

name: Kostchtchie
edict: Eat the flesh of your own kind
anathema: Reveal secrets of the dead to nonbelievers, despoil grave markers

name: Nurgal
edict: Avenge all slights three times over, kill all witches
anathema: Make a deal with Baba Yaga or her children, defer to or obey a woman

name: Orcus
edict: Wage war in the desert, deny water to your foes
anathema: Heal a sunburn, change your name

name: Pazuzu
edict: Become undead through choice and skill, master necromantic magic, create undead
anathema: Become a vampire or accidental undead, give succor to faiths that seek to destroy undead

name: Shax
edict: Tempt others to immoral acts, revel in flight, possess or magically influence others to cause calamities
anathema: Deny a flying creature the ability to fly, abuse Pazuzu’s name or call on Pazuzu for help, aid worshippers of Lamashtu

name: Shivaska
edict: Plot and commit murders, tell lies, torture creatures
anathema: Sleep in a building with fewer than five rooms, allow a victim to escape due to gloating

name: Sifkesh
edict: Accelerate impending doom, demand subservience from your lessers, oppress the weak
anathema: Allow a prisoner to go free, show mercy without personal benefit
domains: Abomination, Darkness, Metal, Pain, Sorrow, Time

name: Sithhud
edict: Spread doubt among the faithful, ruin the reputation of religions, provoke wrongdoers to suicide instead of allowing for redemption
anathema: Spread hope, offer forgiveness, sincerely honor or call upon another god

name: Treerazer
edict: Be as inexorable as a glacier, endure the elements, seek vengeance no matter how long it takes
anathema: Forgive even the smallest slights, offer shelter during a blizzard or ice storm
domains: Ambition, Cold, Toil, Undeath, Vigil, Water

name: Vulot
edict: corrupt plant life with evil or fungal influences, slay elves, feast on rotten flesh or fungus
anathema: grant mercy to elves, plant trees, encourage natural plant growth

name: Xoveron
edict: Steal another’s identity, never introduce yourself the same way twice, use someone else’s reputation to your advantage
anathema: Expose your unadorned face, reveal a conspiracy to the public, surrender a criminal to the authorities
domains: Confidence, Disorientation, Nightmares, Nothingness, Secrecy, Trickery

name: Yhidothrus
edict: Acquire and consume more resources than you need, embrace stillness, ensure ruins remain in their dilapidated state
anathema: Allow a structure to be rebuilt or maintained, practice moderation in consumption
domains: Cities, Decay, Destruction, Earth, Indulgence, Might

name: Zevgavizeb
edict: Advance the destruction of all things, extend your life by any means necessary, sow discord among civilizations
anathema: Act rashly without careful planning, promote the creation of a place, thing, or idea
domains: Death, Decay, Fate, Nothingness, Time, Undeath

name: Zura
edict: Slaughter the cowardly, subjugate the weak
anathema: Favor stealth over shows of strength, eat cooked meat

name: Pathfinder #214: The Broken Palace pg. 77
edict: Drink blood, seek vampirism, cause bleed damage
anathema: Expose vampires, heal a bloody wound without drinking blood from it first
domains: Decay, Disorientation, Indulgence, Nightmares, Swarm, Undeath

name: Apsu
edict: seek and destroy evil, travel the world, help others fend for themselves
anathema: fail to pursue a foe who has betrayed your mercy, attack a creature without certainty of wrongdoing
domains: Creation, Dragon, Freedom, Introspection, Protection, Travel

name: Brixori
edict: pursue knowledge even in the most unusual places, seek to understand that which cannot be explained, show kindness to those who are weaker than the rest
anathema: underestimate an enemy or an ally, treat those weaker than you unkindly

name: Dahak
edict: kill dragons, destroy things at your whim, study past disasters
anathema: spare a foe after you have chosen to kill them, forgive a slight, prevent the destruction of things that cannot be saved

name: Garhaazh
edict: build when it is asked of you, foster growth in others, meditate upon your actions
anathema: act without thinking, hesitate in the face of destructive forces, refuse to change your ways
domains: Change, Cities, Creation, Dragon, Perfection, Toil

name: Draconic Codex pg. 30
edict: act with mutual brutality, let might make right, always boast of your victories
anathema: act with humility, give mercy without supplication, die with grace
domains: Ambition, Confidence, Dragon, Indulgence, Might, Nature, Passion

name: Otilaz
edict: learn from observed mistakes, promote change and growth, accept the inevitable
anathema: seek immortality or enlightenment, become stagnant, believe yourself a learned master
domains: Abomination, Change, Death, Dragon, Introspection, Sorrow, Soul

name: Turvu
edict: feel privileged to witness wonders of creation, find value in being, change to better know yourself
anathema: change yourself for another, be consumed by temporary things, let others define your soul
domains: Creation, Dragon, Fate, Knowledge, Magic, Sorrow, Star, Time

name: Draconic Codex pg. 33
edict: travel and explore the world and other planes, seek to understand all sides of a conflict
anathema: deem anything purely good or evil without first seeking context, remain stagnant in the pursuit of exploration or knowledge
domains: Dragon, Freedom, Introspection, Knowledge, Perfection, Travel

name: Yluma
edict: celebrate your victories and losses, embrace your unique strengths and innate gifts, nurture the flame of acceptance and knowledge in others.
anathema: intentionally mislead people away from understanding themselves, repeatedly deny who you are, treat your gifts as a curse
domains: Confidence, Glyph, Knowledge, Magic, Perfection, Truth

name: Angradd
edict: Seek and destroy evil, study evil to learn the best way to destroy it, train others in righteous ways
anathema: Allow weaker evils to survive due to the presence of larger evils, deceive others outside of tactical gain
domains: Duty, Fate, Fire, Knowledge, Protection, Zeal

name: Bolka
edict: Encourage those seeking love, see the beauty in others, support others’ relationships
anathema: Betray your spouse, disrupt a genuine marriage, prevent a suitor from seeking a partner

name: Dranngvit
edict: Help reclaim just debts, seek appropriate vengeance against transgressions
anathema: Allow a slight to go unrecognized, avoid repaying a debt, force others into debts you know are unpayable
domains: Fate, Knowledge, Might, Travel, Truth, Vigil

name: Droskar
edict: Achieve goals at any cost, continually improve your abilities, establish dominance, work ceaselessly
anathema: Fail to work toward goals or grow in skill, relax excessively or give in to sloth
domains: Ambition, Duty, Earth, Fire, Metal, Toil, Trickery, Tyranny

name: Folgrit
edict: Maintain the sanctity of a home, remain patient with others, take in those without families
anathema: Abandon your family, fail to defend your neighbors
domains: Cities, Duty, Family, Protection, Repose, Sorrow
pantheons: Guardians of the Sacred Self, Stone's Blood

name: Kols
edict: Seek those who break oaths and enforce just restitution, uphold your promises
anathema: Lie, dishonor yourself or your family, shirk your duties, break an oath
domains: Confidence, Duty, Glyph, Knowledge, Might, Secrecy, Truth

name: Magrim
edict: Perfect a craft or trade, carve runes, destroy undead, aid others with completing unfinished tasks
anathema: Treat grave sites irreverently, mistreat your tools, create undead, damage a soul
domains: Creation, Death, Duty, Fate, Glyph, Metal, Soul

name: Trudd
edict: Offer your strength to aid others, protect those weaker than you
anathema: Engage in petty demonstrations of strength, use your strength to take advantage of others
domains: Confidence, Duty, Earth, Might, Protection, Zeal

name: Count Ranalc
edict: Work in shadows, hide your nature and motives, plot betrayals or revenge for betrayals
anathema: Ask for forgiveness, create permanent or long-lasting sources of light

name: Magdh
edict: Pursue your own goals, bring things to their proper ending, split things in half or otherwise create pairs
anathema: Offend Imbrex

name: Ng
edict: Use magic to read the future and understand fate
anathema: Lie, share your magic readings without payment (no matter how trivial)

name: Ragadahn
edict: Travel, hide your identity and your motives
anathema: Sleep in the same place twice in a row, wear seasonal decorations out of season

name: Shyka
edict: Draw spirals, seek primordial secrets, use poison, always carry water
anathema: Suffer a linnorm’s death curse, destroy a fossil

name: The Green Mother
edict: Learn from the past, leave hourglasses in unusual places, give random gifts, create ephemeral things
anathema: Willingly tread where time does not pass

name: Divine Mysteries pg. 306
edict: Frolic in vegetation, manipulate people, use what you kill, prey on the weak
anathema: Hold a secret for too long, discriminate against sex workers or use their trade to harm them

name: The Lantern King
edict: Play pranks, seek new jokes, leave lit lanterns in unusual places
anathema: Be completely honest, ruin or explain a good joke

name: The Lost Prince
edict: Aid the depressed, wear somber clothing, maintain neutrality, ruminate on the past
anathema: Abandon someone who has no family, take public credit for your good deeds

name: Ayrzul
edict: Burn away corruption, clear the way for new growth, purify tainted areas
anathema: Abandon a creature in darkness; deny a suffering creature warmth, shade, or water

name: Ferrumnestra
edict: Obscure your true motives, slowly poison others, use the strength of stone to protect yourself and your secrets
anathema: Make fire larger or hotter than necessary, remove a creature’s petrified condition

name: Hshurha
